javadoc:
Modal dialog to display a list of domain objects that have changed.
 The user can mark the ones to save, or pop up another dialog to save
 the files to a different location and/or name.
 Read-only files are rendered in red and the checkboxes for these files
 cannot be selected.
 If the project has changed, then the first checkbox displayed will be
 for saving the project configuration.

methods.javadoc:
Construct new SaveDataDiaog
@param tool front end tool
methods.name: <init>
showDialog
methods.comment:
Shows the save dialog with the given domain files, but no options to save
 the project.  The dialog will not appear if there is no data that needs
 saving.

params.name: domainFiles
params.comment: The files that may need saving.

return.comment:
true if the user hit the 'Save' or 'Don't Save' option; return false if the
         user cancelled the operation

methods.javadoc: Gets called when the user clicks on the OK Action for the dialog.
methods.name: okCallback
methods.comment: Gets called when the user clicks on the OK Action for the dialog.

methods.javadoc: Gets called when the user clicks on the Cancel Action for the dialog.
methods.name: cancelCallback
methods.comment: Gets called when the user clicks on the Cancel Action for the dialog.

methods.javadoc: Create the panel for this dialog.
methods.name: createPanel
methods.comment: Create the panel for this dialog.

methods.javadoc: Select all files to be saved.
methods.name: selectAll
methods.comment: Select all files to be saved.

name: SaveDataDialog
comment:
Modal dialog to display a list of domain objects that have changed.
 The user can mark the ones to save, or pop up another dialog to save
 the files to a different location and/or name.
 Read-only files are rendered in red and the checkboxes for these files
 cannot be selected.
 If the project has changed, then the first checkbox displayed will be
 for saving the project configuration.
